page.title: 19BETH CHATTO GARDENS
page.content: On Monday 1st July we went to find out about Elmstead Market and Beth Chatto Gardens. Before the 1960s there was no house or garden on the site which was part of the fruit farm owned by Mr. Chatto. In 1976, the year of the great drought, this piece of land was waste, covered with scrubby bushes, mostly brambles with poor thin grass. So huge tools were brought in, and a thick layer of clay up to three feet deep in places. It was a most attractive place with water too. They had all different types of beds. There was a very colourful flower which has the sun reflecting all colours. Its true colour was white. They have giant rhubarb. If you touch the rhubarb and then lick your finger it will make you ill because the rhubarb is poisonous. There are lots of different flowers from rhubarb to chrysanthemums. Katie
